children.subject: As for applicability…it depends on the specific fields that you are interested in or going to employ ML skills.

Data 100 has very light content of ML so you could skip it.
CS 182 is the course to introduce DNN, and it could also be petitioned as a design course for graduation.
CS 170 is the course that could support your programming skills that may be employed in AI/ML.
Apart from the courses above, some decals are also teaching ML in their own ways.

history.content: Hi, I was wondering which classes are typical for the AI/ML route (especially RL). I know about cs188, cs189, eecs126, eecs127, and some upper level RL classes, but was wondering which other supporting classes would increase understanding/applicability of typical classes for this route. Thank you!
history.subject: Classes to take for AI/ML route
